text: Jörg Schlaich (17 October 1934 – 4 September 2021) was a German structural engineer. He was a co-founder of the structural engineering and consulting firm Schlaich Bergermann Partner. He was known for designing the Olympic Stadium, Munich, Gottlieb-Daimler-Stadion and Solar updraft tower. Schlaich died on 4 September 2021 at the age of 86.Stuttgarter Bauingenieur Jörg Schlaich ist tot ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2021 deaths Category:German civil engineers Category:Scientists from Baden-Württemberg
title: Jörg Schlaich
